Marketing/Growth Hacker at Knack

Earth, United States, Remote · Full Time
We do things a little differently and we like it that way. Our team is close-knit, highly-engaged, 100% remote, and dedicated to building a world-class product striving to democratize data and app building. Read More

We do things a little differently and we like it that way. Our team is close-knit, highly-engaged, 100% remote, and dedicated to building a world-class product striving to democratize data and app building.

We're looking for some kindred spirits to join us on this crazy ride.

Find out more at:
https://www.knack.com/work-at-knack

Applied
Apply to Knack
Add a message to Knack
Apply

Job Description

We’re looking for a marketing and growth hacker to help drive Knack's efforts in identifying markets and executing growth initiatives.

We've been managing growth but now it's time to start accelerating!

This position will straddle the traditional marketing world, SEO and Adwords, and the new techniques of growth-hacking, with a heavy emphasis on data and analysis to run experiments and validate hypotheses.

What You'll Do
- Understand Knack users and the competitive market landscape.
- Know the product roadmap and market trends intimately to help devise, plan, and execute strategies and tactics in additional to product launches, to drive awareness and new trials of Knack.
- Manage online marketing efforts including SEO and content marketing.
- Manage the execution of marketing tactics to support audience-specific strategies—everything from blogs, infographics, videos, tweets to landing page messaging – we want you to think outside the box.

What We’re Looking For
- A deep understanding of SaaS analytical numbers like LTV, CAC, Churn, etc.
- Experience in online marketing areas like SEO, content marketing, and PPC campaigns.
- Demonstrated customer focus, with an ability to understand, simplify, and communicate complex ideas
￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼- Analytical skills: analyze user data and implement appropriate tracking to measure marketing success
- A desire to be a part of a long-term, profitable business that makes a great product loved by thousands of customers.

About Knack

Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

So why are we different?

We’re bootstrapped: we’ve had to build something our customers actually pay for. This changes how you do things.

We’re 100% remote: and have been from the beginning. Every decision we’ve made has been based around optimizing our remote operations.

We’re small: and we like it that way. We’re more than just chat avatars-- we’ve all gotten to know each other, have grown together, and love working with each other.

We enjoy the journey: we’re in this for the long haul. We’re not chasing an exit or the next round of funding. We’re building something we’re proud of and want to keep improving on.

You can read more about Knack and the team here.

Benefits & Compensation

Define your work: our only rule is our overlap zone of 11am to 4pm EST. Otherwise find the location, environment, and schedule that is best for your life and work. It’s not about separation, it’s about optimization.

Unlimited Paid Vacation: take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced. You’ll get forced days off for birthdays and knackiversaries.

Paid Corporate Retreats: we get together twice a year at amazing locations to do normal human being things in person. We pay for your flight, lodging, and meals.

Learning Credits: an annual allowance is provided to stay on top of your game with classes, books, and conferences.

HealthCare: we offer health, vision, and dental, covering 75% of the premium for you and your dependents (spouse + children).

Skills
Analytics & Reporting, Product Marketing, SaaS, Conversion Optimization, A/B Testing, Landing Page Optimization, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Funnel Optimization
Compensation
$85K–$110K
0.5%–2.5%

What We're Building

Knack enables non-programmers to do amazing things with their data. It's the central hub that makes it easy to do something useful with all of your data.

Knack starts with storing your data in a simple online database. You can then build simple web apps using search, forms, tables, and more to display, update, and share that data. These apps make it easy to manage and analyze the data, build workflows, share it with other users, and integrate it with other services.

Apps can be published to any site and adapt to the surrounding design. Multiple versions can be published to different sites and for different audiences.

Developers can extend these apps with a RESTful API, custom CSS, and JS event handlers.

Digital Analytics Consultant / Google Analytics at InfoTrust

Cincinnati, United States, Remote · Full Time
InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.Read More

InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.

With two offices (Cincinnati and Dubai), InfoTrust is rapidly growing through its work with some of the largest multinational brands in the world as well as Internet Retailer 1000 companies in North America. Google has recognized InfoTrust with the following certifications – Google Analytics Certified Partner, Google Analytics Premium Reseller and Google Tag Manager Specialist.

InfoTrust is now a four time finalist in Greater Cincinnati’s Best Places to Work (2012, 2013, 2014, 2015). We are also recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the country.

InfoTrust just moved into an amazing new office with lots of sun and open space, sit/stand desks, ping-pong, and daily catered lunch. Our team of web analytics experts have been continuously recognized among the world analytics elite.

We are currently looking for a technologist who is interested in becoming an expert in analytics and digital marketing. If you’re a person who loves technical challenges, learning how things work, looking over code, debugging javascript, and building scalable systems for some of largest websites in the world this will be an ideal role for you. Not only do we work with cutting edge technology, but we work beyond the cutting edge, with access to technologies that are not available to the general public. We are looking for people for whom being first in the world to play with new technology, even before public beta, and potentially coming up with architectures for huge household brands is exciting. If you are one of those people – contact us.

Applied
Apply to InfoTrust
Add a message to InfoTrust
Apply

Job Description

Rocketship -- that is the word that was used to explain what it is like to join InfoTrust at this time. We have done all the prep, we have build this amazing architecture for success (the ship) not we are getting ready to launch? Are you ready to board?

We are currently looking for a DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT who is an expert in analytics and digital marketing.

The Digital Analytics Consultant role will be responsible for client management, advanced implementations of Google Analytics, auditing and troubleshooting existing configurations, and reporting analysis to improve clients’ digital marketing initiatives.

You will work closely with web analytics engineer/architect to develop custom tagging and measurement systems.

Responsibilities:

- Identifying client objectives and mapping suitable analytics solutions, ensuring that all required performance data can be reliably tracked and reported
- Advanced Google Tag Manager architecture and setup of complex tracking scripts
- Producing analytics audit reports for corrective or advanced Google Analytics tracking and data collection architecture
- Performing ad-hoc analytics consultancies for clients and documenting the work
– Delivering analytics audit reports to clients and presenting findings in person or via conference calls
- Representing the InfoTrust team in client meetings and presentations, providing technical analytics input
- Assisting in educating clients on the importance of online measurement & providing best practice guidance for technical aspects of analytics
- Providing training to clients ranging from product training for marketing teams to implementation training for technical teams
- Providing consultancy on campaign tagging and providing consultancy on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
- Providing guidance to data analysts to produce marketing dashboards via Google Drive, Excel and various APIs

Requirements

We are looking for someone the possess our core values and is looking for a place to drive impact, provide superior client support with GA and is looking for learn and grow as an individual and share that knowledge to drive the company towards continued success. The Senior Consultant would be expected to have the following background to be successful:

- Experience working with clients in a consulting role
- Well versed in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager -- from developing client specific implementation plans, to overseeing the implementation and assisting them to identify key ways to improve their marketing initiatives based on the good clean data that InfoTrust will provide.
- Proven experience as a team player -- You enjoy working in a fun and collaborative culture and are willing to take initiative!

We are looking for someone in Cincinnati, Ohio. Ask why Cincinnati might be a great option to relocate to -- we are happy to brag about our city!

We would be willing to consider remote (experienced) workers, just let us know why you are great at working remotely.

Must be authorized to work for any US employer.

PR and Marketing Internship at RiteKit

Earth, Remote · Internship
Our internships are career-makers, but they are UNPAID. We're self-funded and doing this for 6.5 years. We believe in what we do, and are committed to the team and our value proposition. We give back plenty but are not able to compensate interns financially.Read More

Our internships are career-makers, but they are UNPAID. We're self-funded and doing this for 6.5 years. We believe in what we do, and are committed to the team and our value proposition. We give back plenty but are not able to compensate interns financially.

RiteKit interns share insights on the team, experience, career boosts: https://medium.com/hashtag-academy/tagged/ritekitinterns

At our core:
"Enhance": this feature is the gem at the center the RiteBoost automation dashboard and RiteForge, the social publishing SaaS.

The customer's customized "Enhance" does any/all of the following in one click:
• semantically determines topics of a post and auto-hashtags them for current and historical engagement
• Auto-emojify
• converts URLs in social posts to a custom tiny URL with a baked-in advertisement
• if the words in your post are not good as hashtags, Enhance adds up to two at the end of the post
• extracts a good image from images embedded in the body of a page, if the page's URL is in your post
• optional: highlight text or add "quotes" around text before Enhancing - this makes an image from the text, with a customer-branded image background.
• author attribution
• even more options are available

We serve enterprise customers, too: https://ritekit.com/api-demo

We're growing fast, gaining traction, we're going big, and all the while, our culture continues to improve. No one works "for" RiteKit; we listen, mentor, involve people in the decision making. We work "with" people not above them. Please feel welcome to ask any of us to explain what the difference means to to them. See Hashtag Academy in Medium to see their interviews and read what they say about our impact on careers.

What do our interns do after us? Search RiteTag in LinkedIn, then do an advanced search to see the people. Our interns either join the team or have moved on to PopSugar, Google, Snapchat and so on.

Our four SaaS products in 60 seconds: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYKPrk2U4Jo

Applied
Apply to RiteKit
Add a message to RiteKit
Apply

Job Description

All RiteKit internships are unpaid. If you are not considering internships that are without salary or stipend, etc., this is not for you. Also, we work remotely (we all work from where we live).

"Hashtags! Yay!"

NO!!!

That's not actually what we're about. We build a suite of SaaS products for people and companies that expect social ROI: they need to get something back when they share to social.

RiteForge and RiteBoost do total social media optimization: images, custom visuals, link ads - and data-driven auto-hashtagging as well. For those who need to get business, sign-ups, or sales from what they share in Facebook, Twitter and beyond, RiteForge automates image creation and extraction, adds a call-to-action header to pages shared socially, and uses text analysis and machine learning to aid with hashtags as well.

What is RiteKit?
The initial concept for RiteTag, our first product, was borne of the aftermath of the 2011 Earthquake and Tsunami in Japan. After witnessing the flurry of disorganized social media activity, our CEO and Founder wanted to help people get their social content discovered in an increasing noisy world.
What SEO does for web pages, SMO (social media optimization) does for video uploads, sound files, Facebook updates, Tweets... and it is much more than hashtags that does this. Today we continue to build tools to further our original mission to increase the customer's social media presence.

We build data-driven social media engagement SaaS products. Please spend one minute to get a quick understanding of all four of our tools: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYKPrk2U4Jo

What mktg/bizdev Interns (and staff) do:
• Learn far more than they teach in any university degree to prepare for a successful career in PR, Business Development or as an entrepreneur. (Best case scenario: after this internship you either launch your own startup, join one as a co-founder, or become so important to us that you create a position for yourself on our team.)
• Forge alliances with people at companies and startups that should be using our APIs and/or SaaS products
• Engage our growing community in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Medium and beyond.
• Write case study articles for our blogs.
• Do what it takes to get original articles on getting things done with RiteKit in major news sites and top-tier blogs.
• Learn how to win at marketing

Terms & Requirements:
• Ability to learn and teach RiteKit products and coach a business owner to use them so that they get social ROI. This will be your entry exam and how you will qualify for the internship.
• Ability to collaborate in a fast paced distributed startup team
• Commitment: 6 months at 3-5 hours/week OR 12 months at 2~3 hours/week (decide later, no rush)
• Be okay with the internship being UNPAID.
• Must be well-written and have proven ability to create visual content
• No relocation needed; we work remotely

Do ask what our former interns went on to do immediately following their RiteKit internship when you have your first interview (and how to independently research this).

First, see https://medium.com/hashtag-academy/tagged/ritekitinterns and especially the video in https://medium.com/hashtag-academy/ritekit-interns-tell-their-stories-acc09f4e1845 to hear from our former interns, who share what they got from the experience, in learning, career-boosts, jobs and other opportunities, both with RiteKit and other employers.

As a self funded startup, we have been extremely lucky to have a passionate team, advisors and friends that have brought us this far. Unfortunately this also means we can only offer unpaid internships at the time.

Skills
PR, Sales, Social Media Marketing, Public Relations, Customer Relationship Management, Sales and Marketing, Community Development, Customer Success, English language
Compensation

What We're Building

For everyone who needs to get something back from their social stream, RiteKit products automate all the nuisances out of creating, scheduling and publishing social posts with all the social search optimization, advertisements and analytics on links shared and even more.

The essence of each product in 60 seconds: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYKPrk2U4Jo

RiteTag
The browser extension provides a simple color-graded indication of whether your hashtag is likely to help get a post seen, based on real-time engagement.

RiteForge 
Social media post crafting and publishing solution with "Enhance": one click for relevant and reaching hashtags, an ad on links, image options and much more.

items.title: Product Support Expert
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Product Support Expert at Follow Up Boss

Remote

at Follow Up Boss

Work Remote

Who Is Follow Up Boss?

  • We’re a simple, sales-focused CRM for real estate teams (and we use our own product)
  • We’re a self funded, profitable company started back in April of 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric – we live it: https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews
  • Check out our video on how we work: https://www.followupboss.com/about/

Why Work Here?

  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • No red tape or pointless meetings
  • Competitive base salary, health/dental insurance and 20 days paid holiday

This Role Is For You If

  • You would describe yourself as patient, empathetic and having a good sense of humour
  • You’re independent, self-motivated and can stay efficient and productive without someone looking over your shoulder all day long
  • Superb written and verbal skills (with a professional yet fun demeanor).
  • You consider yourself tech savvy and efficient with SaaS applications

Your qualifications:

  • Self motivated and proactive mindset.
  • Remote work experience is considered an asset.
  • Based in the USA, quiet home office with fast internet.
  • Prior experience in a customer-facing role (Support, Success, Account Management, or Sales).

We’re looking for a Product Support Expert to join our team to cover support 8 – 5 PM Tue-Sat EST.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Answering incoming phone calls from customers to offer support
  • Answering support tickets to help customers and free trials (we use Help Scout)
  • On-boarding and setting up new accounts and winning them over from the get-go.
  • Monitoring accounts to ensure that our customers are thrilled, and looking out for (and addressing) warning signs of churn.
  • Advocating customers’ requests and needs across the entire company (we use Basecamp)
  • Educating about newly released features and functionality.
  • Contributing to our Help Center (help.followupboss.com)

30 Day Targets:

  1. Learn the Follow Up Boss software & product offerings to be effective in the position
  2. Complete all position specific on-boarding tasks, setup, and initial training
  3. Virtually meet all Follow Up Boss employees

60 Day Targets:

  1. Actively work in the ticket queue on a daily basis
  2. Answer incoming calls and complete 3 training calls

90 Day Targets:

  1. Meet or exceed KPI expectations
  2. Contribute at least 3 documents to the Help Center

KPI’s:

  1. Average Calls per Day
  2. Average Tickets Per Day (conversations)
  3. Three Help Articles Per Month (new or update)

If this sounds like a great fit we would love to hear from you, drop us a line below.

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager at Auth0

Remote

MARKETING

REMOTE

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 is loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. More than 500.000 unique users visit Auth0.com each month due to our compelling content and the functionality of our identity platform. Our mission is to simplify developers’ lives, improve security, and reduce identity TCO for our enterprise customers, by making identity simple, secure and extensible.

We are recruiting an entrepreneurial, creative and analytical Product Marketing Manager that can not only be a critical source of customer and industry insight, but also craft outstanding content, that will help us attract and retain relevant, quality, customers. If communication’ is one of your biggest strengths, you have a proclivity towards doing’, have a passion for cybersecurity and/or identity technology and can be a self-starter in ambiguous situations, we are looking for you. This role will interface primarily with the Product Management, Sales, and Marketing teams and reports to a Director of Product Marketing.

Responsibilities:

  • Craft messaging frameworks and collateral for different verticals to inform the Demand Gen team campaigns and Sales call scripts.
  • Write and define deep-dive content for marketing initiatives.
  • Use primary and secondary research to build out detailed buyer and user personas.
  • Become well-versed in the type of conversations our Sales teams currently have with customers, who they are talking to at what stage of a deal, and the customers’ use cases for identity.
  • Create thought leadership content pieces by researching relevant topics for particular personas, topics from the identity world, and geopolitical/technology topics related to the same, where relevant.
  • Assist with gathering responses for analyst surveys.
  • Use data to help to analyze the success/failure of content to pick out relevant topics for future areas.
  • Collaborate with Technical Product Marketing managers to write demo scripts and collate competitive reviews.
  • Collaborate closely with Product Managers to illuminate the so what’ of new and updated features to different audiences like customers, sales, analysts and Auth0 employees.
  • Provide well-researched blog outlines to the content team Work with the Customer Marketing team to provide feature upsell value propositions for our customer expansion programs.
  • Work with the Sales Enablement team to build out training programs for AuthU (Auth0 University), where needed.

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience of related, relevant experience in high tech, cybersecurity or science either in Product Marketing, Project Management, Product Management, Sales or a technical role.
  • Motivated and excited by technology.
  • Ability to work with remote team members.
  • Proclivity for doing’ Skilled communicator.
  • Able to collaborate effectively with a diverse, remote team in ambiguous situations.

Location:

  • Remote

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior Marketing Designer (Remote)

Company: Close.io
Headquarters: 100% Remote-First
https://close.io
ABOUT US 
At Close.io we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. We’ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are a ~30 person remote team that is profitable and building a product our customers love.
We are hiring a full-time senior marketing designer to join our growing marketing team to help us create and execute high quality marketing campaigns.

ABOUT YOU
You are an experienced and creative designer with a track record of creating visually compelling and persuasive designs for landing pages, ads, and email.
You’re comfortable working with industry standard tools (like Sketch or Framer) and you can take concepts all the way from idea to execution. This means you can both sketch/design ideas as well as build them into responsive and compliant web pages.

THE ROLE
In this role you will report to the Director of Marketing and work closely with our content writers and product marketers. As our first full time marketing designer, you’ll take ownership of all our marketing design activities including website, email marketing, advertising, and branding.

Typical activities might include:

  • Producing ads for social media ad campaigns
  • Designing graphics to be used in emails and on site pages
  • Designing and producing email templates and landing pages
  • Optimizing existing landing pagesRedesigning our websites
  • Producing downloadable materials like ebooks and templates

Requirements:

  • 4+ years of design experience in an in-house marketing or design team
  • 4+ years experience working for SaaS software products
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating a variety of marketing work or projects
  • Ability to code what you dream up in HTML, CSS, and JS
  • Comfortable sharing work early and working iteratively

Bonus:

  • Experience or understanding of conversion rate optimization techniques and tools
  • Experience with video editing and production

Why work with us...?

  • Our story and team retreat video!
  • Stellar team reviews on Glassdoor
  • Work remotely and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • Enjoy face-to-face time with the whole team on all-expense paid retreats 2x year
  • Experience building a truly successful SaaS company with a dedicated, small  team where you can have a huge impact
  • Above market salary
  • Excellent medical  & dental coverage, including 99% paid premiums and HSA option (**US residents)
  • Matching 401k (**US residents)

Apply for this position

Apply here :) https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/7e63add5-1157-4636-9cf6-f75d6cdec1c5?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WWR

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager (PPC focus)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=5, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At Midrive, we’re reinventing driving and insurance for the digital generation. The old way of doing things is broken. 53% of learners fail their first test. Of those who pass, 1 in 5 crash in the first 6 months. That’s unacceptable.

Our technology helps learners find top-rated instructors and access pay-as-you-go insurance, so they can pass-first time and ultimately become safer drivers.

Since launch, over 300,000 young people in the UK have used our apps, data and tech to gain their independence. We are growing quickly and are now available in over 100 towns and cities in the UK, expanding to a new one each week.

Founded in 2013, Midrive has raised over £7.5m to date from a respected group of well-connected and supportive investors ‒ including Holiday Extras and Initial Capital. You may have heard about our recent crowdfunding round which was the 4th largest equity fund-raise target in Crowdcube's history.

We’ve recently been named #19 in the Startup 100, the annual ranking of the most game-changing and exciting new businesses launched in the last three years. We were also named ‘Digital Business of the Year’ by the Federation of Small Businesses in 2017.

Want to help us build the future of learner driving and insurance? Then join us!

Find out more about us at Midrive.com

REQUIREMENTS

We’re looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience of Google Adwords search campaign management, which would be their main focus in their current role. Data driven and methodical in their approach to performance marketing, they would have a proven ability to drive swift improvements in campaign performance.

This is an exciting opportunity to have an impact managing performance marketing for a fast growth startup! The purpose of the role is to drive efficiencies and growth in our performance marketing channels, including Adwords paid search and paid social campaigns.


Role objectives:

Build a best-in-class performance optimised paid search strategy.
Draw out actionable insights from performance marketing campaign data.
Analyse and report on campaign performance, refining CPA and ROI on all campaigns.
Plan, execute and report on all performance marketing channel tests and trials.
Develop initiatives to scale performance marketing channels in tandem with Midrive’s instructor supply growth across UK postcode areas.
Constantly seek out and trial relevant new channels.
Ensure all ad copy and creative is optimised to deliver the right message to target audiences, reflecting points of difference, addressing known customer interests and pain points in an engaging way.
Work closely with SEO, content and operations teams to share insights from paid performance.

Key skills and experience:

In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience managing Google Adwords. This is a required skill that you will be tested on, so only apply if you are confident that you meet this requirement.
Working knowledge of Facebook Ads and Google Analytics.
Good understanding of audience targeting and remarketing strategies.
Practical understanding of attribution modelling.
Experience managing large or complex paid performance channel budgets.

About you:

You have lived and breathed Adwords campaign management for at least 1-2 years, and are fully up-to-date with every targeting option and campaign management enhancement in the Adwords interface.
You may have gained your experience at a digital advertising agency, managing paid search campaigns on Google Adwords, or client-side in a B2C direct response focused business.
You find working with data stimulating, and can quickly draw out insights from performance marketing campaign data reports.
With a startup mentality, you are self motivated, a problem solver, ambitious, hard working, collaborative, and want to have an impact on business performance.
Ability to approach tasks as a team, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent attention to detail and a well organised, structured approach to work and the ability to keep projects on track.
You speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

BENEFITS

At Midrive, we work hard, so that's why we make sure that we have best facilities to play harder! We have a host of perks: Free coffee and snacks, Wednesdays treats, Happy Hour Thursdays, team yoga sessions, and training/sharing sessions. We also have regular fun social events - recent adventures have included a glamping trip, escape rooms, comedy clubs, and silent discos.

Midrive is simply a great place to work. We have a fantastic team of talented people working on an interesting product they are passionate about, and a friendly, social atmosphere. We're also a dog friendly office! Add to that competitive salaries, pension plan, and other perks, it's clear why we're a top choice.

DIVERSITY

Diversity and inclusion are essential values at Midrive. We know we'll do our best and most impactful work when we feel we're represented and we belong. We're proud to actively recruit and hire talented people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Marketing Manager, Germany
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
_*This role is based in Munich*_

*About us*

GoCardless is building a new global network for recurring bank-to-bank payments. We’re cutting out the intermediaries and linking together direct debit schemes from around the world to create a simple way of collecting payments directly from customers’ bank accounts.

We’ve already won noteworthy German customers, including Magicline and Brandnooz, and have partnerships in place with both best-in-class global and German platforms, including Zuora, Sage and Billwerk. We currently process €3.5bn each year for over 30,000 organisations across the UK and Europe - and we’re growing over 100% year on year.

We’re backed by some of the world’s leading investors including Balderton Capital, Accel Partners, Notion Capital, Passion Capital and Y Combinator.

We’re looking for a talented and passionate German Marketing Manager to drive awareness and adoption of GoCardless in Germany. Focusing on our target segments you’ll be responsible for creating and executing on the marketing strategy generating interest and driving leads and revenue.



*Your role*

Working closely with the German General Manager and Sales team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the German marketing strategy to deliver on the the agreed goals for Germany.
Owning the German marketing budget, you’ll be responsible for planning and implementing specific activities to drive awareness of GoCardless and generate a consistent stream of quality leads and customers to meet the revenue targets.

Supported by the wider Marketing team and a network of freelancers and/or agencies you’ll execute and optimise on campaigns to ensure we’re attracting and retaining the right type of businesses within our core target segments.



*What we're looking for*

We’re looking for a self-starter, excited by an opportunity to grow a rapidly expanding business in a relatively new market. We’d love to hear from you if you have an entrepreneurial spirit, enjoy working in small, autonomous cross-functional teams and are willing go the extra mile to get a job done.

*You should apply if:*

* You have a strong marketing background in B2B businesses in the German market
* You are experienced in working across multiple marketing channels, optimising the mix and the messaging for different audiences
* You are commercially astute and results driven, with strong quantitative analytical skills using tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau
* You have experience and are comfortable owning social media channels and monitoring engagement levels
* You are customer focused ensuring that your messaging and communications resonates with the target audience generating quality leads and long lasting relationships
* You are a self-starter who thrives on working independently with small cross functional teams and is comfortable with working remotely from the central business
* You have excellent communication and written skills and enjoy creating and editing great content
* You’re able to work across multiple teams and manage both agencies and freelancers
* German mother tongue and fluent in English mandatory, French or Spanish knowledge a plus

_Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply._

items.content:
MARKETING ASSOCIATE

Capdesk is looking for someone to join our young and rapidly scaling start-up. We’re changing the world of finance across Europe and we want a smart, hard-working and creative marketing associate to help us. Our small but expanding UK team is based in London just off Shoreditch High Street.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a bright candidate to get into the world of FinTech and take on responsibility as one of the first junior hires on the team. You’ll see first-hand what it takes to build an industry leading FinTech startup as you’ll be working closely everyday with the CEO, Head of Sales and Head of Customer Success.

COMPANY

At Capdesk we are on a mission to change the way that start-ups and investors manage their shareholdings and investments. We launched in Denmark in 2015 and gained customers across the Nordics. In 2016 we moved over to the UK and in 2017 we really solidified our presence here.

We’re already helping some of the tech scene’s major players by removing the headaches associated with organising Shareholder Registers and Option Plans. Companies like Secret Escapes, Tab Media, Money Dashboard & Nutmeg. That’s why we’re Europe’s leading equity management platform. But this is just the start for us. 2019 promises to be a huge year at Capdesk and we want you to help continue our fantastic growth.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Actively manage and promote our blog, and articles.

- Researching and organizing facts and sources.

- Writing and proof reading a wide variety of topics for multiple platforms and overseeing the production of all marketing materials (website, blogs, articles, social updates, banners, case studies, guides, white papers, emails etc.)

- Working with in-house designers to produce materials of visual impact and within brand guidelines.

- Create content marketing campaigns to drive leads and subscribers

- Use SEO best practices to generate traffic to our site.

CANDIDATE

You should be excited about getting in on the ground floor of a fast growing FinTech startup with a presence across Europe. We will teach you the technical aspects of how start-up financing works so we don’t expect a financial background or any formal training. However, this role is best suited to someone who has a natural passion for startups and wants to learn more.

We are looking for hires who can grow with the business so that means having a passion for learning and coming up with new ideas. We want people to own the process and continuously look for a better way to get things done.

BENEFITS

- Be part of a fast growing startup

- Work closely with the Co-founders everyday

- Free team lunch every day! We normally go to somewhere around Spitalfields Market or - Devonshire Square

- First junior hire on the team. Great opportunity for growth

- Work for company with expansion plans across Europe

items.content:
Product Support Expert

Company: Follow Up Boss
Headquarters: Remote
https://grnh.se/795355f81
Who Is Follow Up Boss?

  • We’re a simple, sales-focused CRM for real estate teams (and we use our own product)
  • We’re a self funded, profitable company started back in April of 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric - we live it: https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews
  • Check out our video on how we work: https://www.followupboss.com/about/

Why Work Here?

  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • No red tape or pointless meetings
  • Competitive base salary, health/dental insurance and 20 days paid holiday

This Role Is For You If…

  • You would describe yourself as patient, empathetic and having a good sense of humour
  • You’re independent, self-motivated and can stay efficient and productive without someone looking over your shoulder all day long
  • Superb written and verbal skills (with a professional yet fun demeanor).
  • You consider yourself tech savvy and efficient with SaaS applications

Your qualifications:

  • Self motivated and proactive mindset.
  • Remote work experience is considered an asset.
  • Based in the USA, quiet home office with fast internet.
  • Prior experience in a customer-facing role (Support, Success, Account Management, or Sales).

We’re looking for a Product Support Expert to join our team to cover support 8 - 5 PM Tue-Sat EST.

Your responsibilities will include: 

  • Answering incoming phone calls from customers to offer support
  • Answering support tickets to help customers and free trials (we use Help Scout)
  • On-boarding and setting up new accounts and winning them over from the get-go.
  • Monitoring accounts to ensure that our customers are thrilled, and looking out for (and addressing) warning signs of churn.
  • Advocating customers’ requests and needs across the entire company (we use Basecamp)
  • Educating about newly released features and functionality.
  • Contributing to our Help Center (help.followupboss.com)

30 Day Targets:

  1. Learn the Follow Up Boss software & product offerings to be effective in the position
  2. Complete all position specific on-boarding tasks, setup, and initial training
  3. Virtually meet all Follow Up Boss employees

60 Day Targets:

  1. Actively work in the ticket queue on a daily basis
  2. Answer incoming calls and complete 3 training calls

90 Day Targets:

  1. Meet or exceed KPI expectations
  2. Contribute at least 3 documents to the Help Center

KPI’s:
  1. Average Calls per Day
  2. Average Tickets Per Day (conversations)
  3. Three Help Articles Per Month (new or update)

Apply for this position

Apply at https://grnh.se/795355f81

Content Marketing Intern at Reedsy

Western Europe, United States, Canada, Remote · Internship

We are a fast-growing startup, recognized as one of the most exciting companies in the publishing space. We're a remote team of 16 and speak 10 languages. Come build the future of this industry with us.

Applied
Apply to Reedsy
Add a message to Reedsy
Apply

Job Description

#About Reedsy

We’re here to help authors find world-class professionals to create amazing books. Our curated marketplace gathers some of the best freelancers — the likes of Stephen King's designer, Neil Gaiman's editor or Walter Isaacson's publicist.

Using a content marketing-led strategy, we’ve grown to a community of 100,000 authors in just a few short years (while picking up a number of industry awards along the way). Funded by Europe’s top business angels and VCs, we want to make it possible for anyone looking to publish a high-quality book to do it successfully.

Want to help us?

#Job Description

You will take a hands-on role in executing Reedsy’s content marketing strategy, with a focus on creating and exploiting blog content to acquire leads. You will learn and action the marketing team’s proven approach for:

Keyword research: determining what topics and keywords to attack;
Content creation: how to write a best-in-class blog post that blows the competition out of the water;
Content promotion: getting eyeballs and clicks;
Working efficiently in a flexible, independent, remote environment.

In short, if you have an interest in startup culture and want to know how to rapidly acquire targeted leads, then this is your perfect role.

#Person Specification
Strong interest in content marketing, SEO and startups;
Native-level English speaker;
Can communicate ideas clearly and succinctly through writing;
Strong attention to detail.

#Bonus Points
A proven writing background (i.e. blogs, essays)
Fluent in a second language
A strong dash of ambition (without any BS)
An urge to initiate and act on your own ideas
Good sense of humor

#Want to know why you should join us?
Watch this video: https://youtu.be/3ey0FX19eVo

#How to Apply
We currently receive over 30 applications every day, so generic messages almost never get a second look.

To stand out, make sure you:

1) Do some research on Reedsy and sign up to try the product;
2) Include a well-structured and **concise** message with your application. Explain why you find Reedsy interesting and why you'd be a good fit;
3) Show off what you have to offer — but not too much :)

Compensation
$0K–$5K
No Equity

Not available

GUILD makes it easy for businesses to tap outside expertise. We are tweaking the business consulting industry, valued at $200Bn+ in US alone.

Our team is constantly experimenting with exciting ideas. BIG IDEAS. Ideas sourced from our users (senior consultants & business executives) and other industries... and we execute on them faster every day.

Applied

Job Description

GUILD is looking for an experienced digital marketing/ product management professional. For our unique B2B consulting service, the position will,

1. Create a high-value audience of business prospects
2. Build and optimize the online lead generation funnel
3. Support sales team members in converting online prospects to new clients

Responsibilities include, managing:

- High-level design and copywriting
- Content creation/curation/editing
- SEO
- Content marketing
- Email campaigns
- Social media
- Landing pages
- Channel partnerships
- Conversion metrics

The position will be "lightly" supported by our current staff, so an entrepreneurial/hacker mindset is a must.

It will start as a part-time position for a period of up to 6 months. This period will be used to experiment with new go-to-market ideas.

The fixed pay during this period will be a maximum of $1,000 per month. Performance-based pay is open to discussion. As a policy, all positions in our company are at least 25% "performance-based pay".

What We're Building

GUILD (previously Mentors Guild) makes it easy for businesses to leverage outside expertise.

Not only do our clients get access to specialized expertise, in addition, through our vast member-base we bring to them the exact past experience needed to solve their most pressing challenges.

Our clients are not constrained by internal or locally available expertise, nor do they need to pay exorbitant fees to consulting firms to hire "generalists". By consulting specialists, on demand and always within budget, our clients shrink the learning curve in solving complex issues or getting to the next level.

GUILD connects them directly to Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) from all over the country. In select cities, our Growth Partners engage as onsite project managers, and take care of administrative overheads like contracts, milestones and payments.

In a $200Bn consulting industry plagued by high project failures, we offer a one-of-its-kind service which puts our clients in the driver's seat.

Content Marketing at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied

Job Description

Do you enjoy watching films? Does learning new things excite you? Are you curious about the world around you? Are you a communicator?

We’re looking for content/ marketing interns to join shortfundly, which has grown in over a year from just an idea to being one of Asia’s leading online short film promotion platform.

The applicant should also:
– loves films, people, technology
– loves, eats and breathe social media
– have basic skills in Photoshop, Word processing
– based in chennai/kerala/hyderabad/Mumbai/Anywhere in South central Asia (India / sri lanka / Singapore / Malaysia)

Responsibilities:
_ Write blog post about our platform product / short films / film festival events
_ Share this & put content marketing techniques to reach global short film filmmaker audience and acquire users.

Our team consists of folks of diverse experience and interests and we are keen to share our thoughts and learning along the way as we chart new grounds.
If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile.

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job

– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job

– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

  • Shortfundly
  • Product
  • Jobs
  • Team
Applied

Marketing at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. Marketing
c. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different shortfilm categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the shortfilm festival circuit. Shortfundly shares plenty of new films every day. We are planning for big expansions in the future into other languages. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

We are looking for a “Superstar” Marketing who take this to 100,000 customers within one year. If you are looking a challenge and ready to chase numbers, this could be it. We won't offer any salary hikes or comfy office, but we offer a great role with full ownership and grow with the company.

Roles
- Increase customer acquisition through Online and Offline marketing
- Strong experience towards Digital Marketing
- Bring in new ideas and execute them
- Tracking and managing marketing campaigns
- Sell the product with positioning not with discounts
- Create a buzz around the brand Shortfundly
- Scaling the marketing team along with business requirements

Requirements
- Worked on B2C brand before in marketing
- Examples of successful marketing campaigns executed
- Managed teams and interacted across levels
- Knowledge of Tamil and/or other Southern Languages would be a plus

Lets us know in 3 to 5 lines, why you are a Superstar “Marketer” in your email to be considered. Mail to support@shortfundly.com.

Skills
Marketing, Branding, Product Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Digital Marketing, Marketing and Branding, Marketing & Branding, Marketing Management, Digital Marketing and Branding
Compensation
No Salary

We realised that we were not alone: how can our stories find its own voice among the noise?

As technology is a big part of our DNA, we embarked on this journey to enable the process of discovery for this generation of audiences: for local and regional films to be consumed locally, and to create a gateway for great Asian films for a global audience

With a growing audience to the ﬁlms, we aim to support both consumers and producers of film content in this thriving ecosystem.

This is the future of cinema and future of crowdfounding shortfilms

Social media marketing at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

We have grown over the past year to be one of the leading online platforms for indian short films and stories. Our films have been watched by thousands of audience and you have the opportunity to engage and build our passionate community!

You will be part of our core team, working closely with our founders, editor and content manager. Your key goal will be to grow new audience by community building – to engage with our audience and foster the relationships to reach their networks.

The role will include, but not limited to:
– Communicate with our audience using our social media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc), email and chat channels
_ Answer to quora questions
_ Tweet with our #shortfundly hashtags.
_ Manage facebook fan page
_ Add our short films into pinterest page
_ Talking to film festival facebook pages event organizers in facebook.
– Using analytic tools to understand our audience
– Manage publisher syndication to extend our community outreach online
– Community engagement offline

Perks of working at Shortfundly:

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job
– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job
– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile .

Skills
Social Media, Lead Generation, Social Strategy, Social Media Marketing, Innovation & Growth, Digital Marketing, Social Media Strategy, Growth Strategy and Execution, Quora, Twitter Marketing, Facebook, Social Networking

Data Driven SEO Specialist at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

We are looking for a SEO specialist to join the Shortfundly crew!

You will have the opportunity to work across our web products including a video platform for audience and a content management system for creators. We looking to experiment on new engagement & retention techniques – so that will be something exciting & fun! Your work will touch the lives of millions, and spread awesome shortfilm from india to the world.

General Skills:

Administer search engine programs (XML sitemaps, webmaster tools) for purposes of diagnostic reporting

Working with research tools such as Woorank, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz Analytics, Google Analytics and Webmaster tools

Develop relationships with bloggers, webmaster & build organic links

Develop and execute link building strategy; optimize links for search relevance and implement link building programs/tactics

Develop/execute SEO strategies to achieve and maintain top rankings on major search engines

Assist in development and execution of communication/content strategies via social communities in coordination with SEO goals

Keep pace with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends and developments

Forming processes for teamwork involving social, copywriting, and development resource

Experience – 0 to 2 years

Qualification – Doesn’t matter

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job
– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job
– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job
Benefits & Culture
– Flexible hours
– Professional Development
– Small team where everyone is valued

If you are interested , forward your resume to info@shortfundly.com with a brief paragraph summarizing your skill set and experience along with a portfolio of the work you believe is relevant. Send Your Linkedin profile, It’s mandatory.

Skills
SEM, SEO, SEO/SEM, Search, Search Engine Optimization, SEO and Marketing Services, Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Digital Marketing, Digital Optimization Including SEO, SEO and Internet Markeitng, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Google AdSense, Analtyics, Google Adwords and Analytics, SEO and Website Analytics, Ahrefs, MOZ Tools, WooRank, SEMRush

Looking for Marketing guy with creative bent at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. Marketing
c. Startup culture
Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different short film categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the short film festival circuit. We are planning for big expansions in the future into other languages. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

Qualification – Doesn’t matter

Experience – 0 to 2 years in sales/ marketing/ script writing/ video making

Location – Any location

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job

– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job

– Salary with an ESOP component to the tune of 0.5% to 1.00%.

– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

:)

Role and Responsibilities:

We need to put our marketing efforts to bring shortfilm makers to our platform
Getting partnership to publish shortfilm in our platfrom through film institute in india.
One more thing, getting shortfilm festival event organizing people to our platform and help them to organize their festival super easy.
Skills – marketing / script writing/ video making

Why you should join:

To learn marketing, get chance to meet all film celebrity and grow your career at fast pace

Let’s change the experience of short film watching and sharing, together!

If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile.

Digital Marketing Manager at zipBoard

Delhi, Remote · Full Time
At zipBoard, we believe in letting our employees do their thing and choose the best course of action in their individual tasks, because we understand how smart people work and that it doesn’t make much sense in telling them what to do at each and every step.Read More

At zipBoard, we believe in letting our employees do their thing and choose the best course of action in their individual tasks, because we understand how smart people work and that it doesn’t make much sense in telling them what to do at each and every step.

We don’t believe résumés carry much weight these days, and that’s why we don’t take them as seriously as you might imagine. Working at zipBoard is much more than just a job, it’s a rich learning experience. We want our team to grow with us, learning new skills and taking on new challenges as we venture into unexplored territories.
We value work ethics and are not overly strict when it comes to company policies. So don’t worry about making an honest mistake. Together, we can handle it. The only thing you will be judged on when you enter the office is your passion for the work you do.

If you believe you fit right into our hardworking close-knit team, you are more than welcome to come work with us.

items.content:
Product Manager

Marketing
GMT to GMT+5:30 Time Zones
Company: Wikimedia Foundation
Full Time

Overview

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for an experienced, collaborative, and entrepreneurial Product Manager for emerging markets to help engage and delight new readers of Wikipedia. In this role, you will work with the  to define product strategy and prototype, test, and build new features for mobile devices.

New Readers program

Product Managers at the Wikimedia Foundation work with researchers, engineers and designers to build features, products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world to learn and share knowledge.

As a Product Manager, you will:   
  • Ideate and develop new mobile products to enable the growing mobile population in emerging markets to consume educational information.
  • Work with a highly talented team of engineers and designers to define, design, and build features that are designed for cheap phones on slow networks, in multiple languages
  • Understand the needs of users in order to prioritize new features and product enhancements for the development team using qualitative research and an understanding of local nuances in various markets
  • Release early and often, getting feedback from users to help improve features.
  • Use both qualitative and quantitative methods to measure the impact of features
  • Make a difference in the world!

    • Requirements:   
    • Product Management experience with a mobile app or mobile web property in emerging markets
    • Experience launching and growing products in emerging markets
    • Experience working with multilingual products
    • Experience working in an agile software development environment
    • Demonstrated understanding of modern mobile technologies and industry trends
    • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
    • Passion for participatory (vs. read-only) experiences on the web
    • Live in time zones GMT to GMT +5:30

      • Pluses:  
      • Experience editing Wikipedia or contributing to other Wikimedia projects
      • Experience with open source software development
      • Familiarity with MediaWiki is a plus
      • Experience with delivering high quality and user friendly participatory design
      • Experience working remotely

        • The Wikimedia Foundation is… 

        …the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

        The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

        Benefits & Perks *
        • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
        • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
        • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
        • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
        • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
        • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
        • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
        • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
        • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
        • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

          • * for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

          More information

          WMF

          Blog

          Annual Report – 2017

          Wikimedia 2030

          To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/wikimedia/jobs/1286816 →

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism at Crowdera

India, Mumbai, Nagpur, Remote · Full Time

Probably there are a million ways to build promising career, but nothing beats being part of a compassion driven economy where abundance starts with giving. Crowdera has created world’s first truly free fundraising platform that does not charge any commission or ask for tip from donors. We are changing the way people give and align themselves with the causes and individuals they fund & support. Our continuos evolution will help fundraisers to add sustenance to their organizations, improve their lives, make a lasting impact. What we are set to achieve in next few years will make you fall in love with us. Plus, you get to work with & mentored by silicon valley business leaders and tech gurus with pedigree of eBay, Amazon, Google, Columbia. Ask us and we will give 10 more reasons to work with us.

Applied
Apply to Crowdera
Add a message to Crowdera
Apply

Job Description

As GM India, you will report directly to the founder and will be part of core management team. Your sole purpose is to set-up a strong presence of Crowdera in India by evangelizing, and to progress the vision of the company through action on the ground. You have to a self-starter, build the Indian operations ground up, evangelize & scale Crowdera's brand among all business associates and partners – philanthropists, social entrepreneurs, high net worth donors & investors, corporates, celebrities or government officials.

In this demanding and multidimensional role, you will serve as a trusted aide to the founder on planning and execution of all matters pertaining to Crowdera’s India operations.

Success in this role will be defined by your ability to think both strategically and tactically, exercise good judgment, build and manage excellent relations with clients, lead team and numerous assignments with perfection in a fast-paced and creative environment.

Responsibilities
- Evangelize Crowdera vision and mission within India.
- Spearhead the customer development & customer fundraising success.
- Build partnerships with large corporations, public sector, third sector, foundations, celebrity circuit, and HNIs in APAC.
- Lead sales and corporate development in corporate giving space and fundraising space.
- Keep track of new legislative developments on CSR and trends in Corporate Giving.
- Build & manage India team. Be responsible for all HR functions and beyond– morale, motivation, performance, hiring, retention, termination.

Skills
Business Development, Corporate Development, Product Marketing, Non-Profit Experience, Customer Development, Social Media Marketing, Press Outreach, Social Entrepreneurship, Sales and Marketing, Executive Leadership, Crowdfunding, Social Media Strategy, Corporate Social Responsibility, Corporate and Marketing Strategy, Non-Profit Fundraising, Press and Corporate Communications, Nonprofit Management, Philanthropy, Celebrity/Influencer Outreach, Employee Engagement and CSR activities

What We're Building

Crowdera is a cloud-based fundraising platform and offers a comprehensive fundraising framework for non-profits and social innovators to raise funds without any form of donor dippings. It facilitates all aspects of the online fundraising ecosystem including donation buttons, cross-site donation widgets, websites (CMS), P2P campaigns, donation management, and much more.

Crowdera complements nonprofit's existing fundraising activities and helps them to increase their overall funding & impact by offering a user-friendly, fee-free platform to create visually compelling, viral team fundraising campaigns that help them build meaningful engagement, spread their messages, and expand their donor base.

Crowdera is building a very simple and scalable technology driven business model that would help corporations, fundraisers & Crowdera to be successful at the same time.

What We're Building

Crowdera is a cloud-based fundraising platform and offers a comprehensive fundraising framework for non-profits and social innovators to raise funds without any form of donor dippings. It facilitates all aspects of the online fundraising ecosystem including donation buttons, cross-site donation widgets, websites (CMS), P2P campaigns, donation management, and much more.

Crowdera complements nonprofit's existing fundraising activities and helps them to increase their overall funding & impact by offering a user-friendly, fee-free platform to create visually compelling, viral team fundraising campaigns that help them build meaningful engagement, spread their messages, and expand their donor base.

Crowdera is building a very simple and scalable technology driven business model that would help corporations, fundraisers & Crowdera to be successful at the same time.
